Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Added alternative license expression URLs to be allowed in without warning into Gallery" (#6649) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Display package page does a query per version -- for latest symbols package" (#6650) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
`DisplayPackageViewModel` has a line where it calls `package.LatestSymbolPackage()`. `DisplayPackageViewModel` is initialized per package version when viewing the display package page. `package.LatestSymbolPackage()` does a SQL query.

This is the average number of SQL queries per display package page view:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/48296230-f1c81500-e448-11e8-950f-2df2ae8ad5cf.png)

```
dependencies
| where timestamp > ago(30d)
| where type == "SQL"
| where operation_Name == "GET packages/DisplayPackage" 
| summarize sum(itemCount) / dcount(operation_Id) by bin(timestamp, 6h)
| render timechart 
```

Clearly around October 24, we deployed this bug.

**We should have a unit test that the number of queries to render a page with 3 versions does not grow when there are 4 versions.**

/cc @ryuyu @loic-sharma


Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Certain strange OData requests result in HTTP 500" (#6601) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This can trigger "failed request" alert that we have set up in Application Insights.

Examples:
```
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/lazy/>=1.0.5 <1.1
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/mysql/*
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/mysql-pool/*
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/comb/*
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/express/*
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/hive-cache/*
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/mysql/*
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/comb/>=0.0.2
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/hive-cache/*
https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/mysql/*
```

All of these result in HTTP 500 by redirecting to the 500 error page, e.g.
```
https://www.nuget.org/Errors/500?aspxerrorpath=/api/v2/lazy/%3E=1.0.5%20%3C1.1
```

These should probably be 404s.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget help shows Windows-specific locations on Linux" (#7499) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

nuget client  2.8.7.0  on Ubuntu 16.10

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Type `nuget help`

## Results

```                                                   
             NuGet's default configuration is obtained by loading %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config, then loading any nuget.config or
..                    
 sources     Provides the ability to manage list of sources located in %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config     
```

## Expected 

I'm on Linux, %AppData% is not relevant to me. It should say ~/.config/NuGet/NuGet.Config or ~/.nuget/NuGet/NuGet.Config

There are more hits in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/fc0c2072b79674975d6fac5f332ae8359cef094a/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/NuGetCommand.resx

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error codes regression for validating signatures" (#7492) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
It looks like the change: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2391/files#diff-c6fa634239b1e7654fa549386f77ed3cL206 introduced regressions. The earlier route would return NU3028, however, this change is returning NU3018 error codes. 

@PatoBeltran knows the context.

This change has broken NuGet/NuGet.Jobs [SignatureValidatorIntegrationTests](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/352ce8d5a2306ce735703e2fa2bc48ebe82ce24b/tests/Validation.PackageSigning.ProcessSignature.Tests/SignatureValidatorIntegrationTests.cs#L357) It expects the logged messages to contain

>NU3028: The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: The revocation function was unable to check revocation because the revocation server was offline.

However, actual logged messages are something like:
> Signed package TestSigned.leaf 1.1.0 passed format verification for validation 2eb974b0-8103-48b4-892e-d805052da1a0. Errors:  Warnings: \r\nNo repository signatures needed removal from package TestSigned.leaf 1.1.0 for validation 2eb974b0-8103-48b4-892e-d805052da1a0.\r\nSigned package TestSigned.leaf 1.1.0 passed full signature integrity and trust verification for validation 2eb974b0-8103-48b4-892e-d805052da1a0. Errors:  Warnings: NU3018: The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: The revocation function was unable to check revocation because the revocation server could not be reached. For more information, visit <url>., NU3018: The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: The revocation function was unable to check revocation for the certificate.\r\nAuthor signed package TestSigned.leaf 1.1.0 for validation 2eb974b0-8103-48b4-892e-d805052da1a0 is valid with certificate fingerprint: <fingerprint>

Also, following tests are broken due to same issues:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/352ce8d5a2306ce735703e2fa2bc48ebe82ce24b/tests/Validation.PackageSigning.ProcessSignature.Tests/SignatureValidatorIntegrationTests.cs#L363
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/352ce8d5a2306ce735703e2fa2bc48ebe82ce24b/tests/Validation.PackageSigning.ProcessSignature.Tests/SignatureValidatorIntegrationTests.cs#L1452
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/352ce8d5a2306ce735703e2fa2bc48ebe82ce24b/tests/Validation.PackageSigning.ProcessSignature.Tests/SignatureValidatorIntegrationTests.cs#L1511

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet list package outdated should not list RIDs" (#7497) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Using the current dotnet CLI 3.0 preview, `dotnet list package --outdated --include-transitive` lists each TFM twice, the second time with some extra transitive runtime packages. It should skip RIDs and only output each TFM once, as it does with the dotnet CLI 2.2.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Imports and EnsureNuGetPackageBuildImports target not being added to project when installed" (#7496) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I created a custom project type and when I add a NuGet package in Visual Studio, the imports and EnsureNuGetPackageBuildImports target is not being added to the project file. The project is using a packages.config file.

I was debugging with dotPeek and found that in VsMSBuildProjectSystem, the imports were being added correctly and I could see it in the Xml property of MSBuildEvaluationProject. But once the install was complete, the project file was not updated and no changes were saved.

I downloaded this repo and built commit version 5.0.0.5495 to debug. I added a save in MicrosoftBuildEvaluationProjectUtility.AddImportStatement
`
                AddEnsureImportedTarget(msBuildProject, targetsPath);
                msBuildProject.ReevaluateIfNecessary();
                msBuildProject.Save(); // Added this line
`

and the project is saved correctly with the imports!

However, at the end of NuGetPackageManager.ExecuteNuGetProjectActionsAsync it calls
`await nuGetProject.SaveAsync(token);`
and the changes are reverted back.

I checked the history of VsMSBuildProjectSystem and found that this commit fixes the problem!
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/4102a9a95ed1d1da3b10391fdfdf3395b284ad56
However, it appears it was reverted shortly after.

I'm using Visual Studio Community 15.8.9

_If you're wondering why I used that commit it's because the configure powershell script was not working. I reverted back until it did work. It appears it was trying to run MSBuild from the Enterprise folder, but I only have Community edition. Must have broke somewhere since 5.0.0.5495. Let me know if you would like me to create another issue for that._

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure][Client Policies] Unexpected error show when installing with trusted signers and package that will produce any warning on accept mode" (#7488) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Release-4.9.0-rtm\4.9.0.5661
VS Version: D15.9\28306.50
OS Version: Windows 10 RS4_Release 17134.1.180410-1804
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Create a new test certificate:  `.\CreateTestCertificate.ps1 -AddAsTrustedRootAuthority (certificate fingerprint="AAAAA")`
2. Sign a package:  `NuGet.exe sign <PackageFilePath> -CertificatePath <PfxFilePath>`
3. Create a project, add required mode in nuget.config file with trusted signers list:
```
  <config>
     <add key="signatureValidationMode" value="require" />
  </config>
  <trustedSigners>
     <author name="JamieZhang">       
         <certificate fingerprint="AAAAA" hashAlgorithm="SHA256" allowUntrustedRoot="false" />
     </author>
  </trustedSigners>
```
4. Reload the solution, update the package source to the above package path (step2), install the package into the project in PM UI and CLI (cd to the project path and "nuget install PackageName")

## Expected
There is an error NU3027: The signature should be timestamped to enable long-term signature validity after the certificate has expired, and the package was not installed in the project..

## Actual
Unexpected error NU3034 show as below:
```
NU3034: Package 'JamiePackage006 1.0.0' from source 'C:\Users\v-luzh\source\repos\Package006\Package006': This package is signed but not by a trusted signer.
```
## Note
It can repro on both PM UI and CLI.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Failed to restore NuGets from local source with trailing backslash" (#7495) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: NuGet.Configuration assemblies

NuGet version (4.8.0):

OS version: macOS 10.13.6

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: N/A

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Originally filed on [Developer Community against Visual Studio for Mac](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/374264/failed-to-restore-nugets-from-local-source-with-tr.html).

1. Have a NuGet.Config file that uses a backslash for a local package source.
2. With a custom NuGet package in the package source that is defined with a backslash and a project that uses it.
3. Get the package source information.
4. Package source information contains a backslash.

Sample test project - https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/374264/failed-to-restore-nugets-from-local-source-with-tr.html

Not sure if this is would be considered a bug in NuGet. NuGet could fix up Windows path separators so things work on the Mac.

### Sample Project

https://github.com/mrward/TestNuGetPackageSourceBackslashMac

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PackageID not taken as dependency name for .net framework projects in ProjectReferences" (#7494) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
The id in the generated nuspec is not the expected value from PackageId when referencing a .net framework csproj. The nuget is created via msbuild -t:pack, but the nuget restore was first done in Visual Studio. This is identical to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4642 but with .net framework projects.

NuGet product used VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): Visual Studio 15.8.9 and Nuget.Build.Tasks.Pack v4.6.2

VS version (if appropriate): 15.8.9

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Win10 v1607 (14393.2551)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a solution with a .net standard, and 2 .net framework projects

2. Add <PackageId> tag to the .net framework and .net standard projects so you can differentiate them from the project name

3. Make sure style is PackageReference, add Nuget.Build.Tasks.Pack to all projects and restore

4. Project reference one .net framework and the .net standard projects from the second .net framework project

5. msbuild the .net framework project with the project references

Expected: nuspec in nupkg contains <PackageId> value
Actual: For the .net framework project it contains the name of the csproj

Alternative steps: use the attached file

### Sample Project

Attached:
[BadIdentity.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/2565999/BadIdentity.zip)

### Related issue

https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4642
This issue is identical but the fix may only cater to .net core projects.

### Workaround

Restore with msbuild before invoking pack. The restore from Visual Studio is the culprit.
